TopicTitle: 1: The toggle view of fairings does not work correctly. 2: Moving the fairing often sticks the part to your cursor.

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.1.2 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Windows 10 Pro | CPU: AMD Ryzen 9 5900X | GPU: GeForce RTX 4080 | RAM: 32gb, DDR4 HyperX 2133MHz

 

Issue #1: The toggle view of fairings does not work correctly.

Gameplay severity: Medium - feature not working as expected.

Set-up description: In VAB, building the fairings works as supposed until the eye-shaped button is pressed to enable the toggle view of the fairing/ cross sectional cut of the fairing. 

Issue description: Instead of toggling the view fairing like in KSP1 when when the fairing expands nicely upon mouse hover - exposing the (fairing) contents, the fairing in KSP2 only moves slightly away from the vessel, usually having little to none-at-all effect of effectively exposing the contents (rocket/ satellite/ etc.). It does somewhat allow you to work with the vessel, though it is very clunky and will cause you to usually end up re-building your fairing from scratch. 

Comment/ User initiated solution: This unintended feature/ bug is making working with every fairing quite irritating, thus taking away the relaxing aspect of the vessel building. A possible solution for this could* be to allow the user to manually move the fairing with the "Rotate & Translate tool", so that the fairing can be moved as far/ close as the user is comfortable with as well as an addition of "Reset View" button on the fairing, either by the "Eye-button" of the "wrench-button" - which would reset the fairing into default view mode. 

 

Issue #2: Moving the fairing often sticks the part to your cursor.

Gameplay severity: Medium - feature not working as expected.

Set-up description: In VAB,  moving the smaller fairings sometimes "stick" to your mouse cursor.

Issue description:  When the fairing "stick" to your cursor, you can not move, place, attach or edit the part with your cursor. This usually occurs randomly when moving the fairing. (At least for me)

Comment/ User initiated solution: Shaking your cursor/ clicking random places seems to "unstick" the part (?!), alternatively pressing delete button on keyboard works.
